subject: Re: [junit] assertEquals(Object, Object)
msgSnippet: No. ... From: Mike Clark  To:  Sent: Friday, May 10, 2002 10:49 PM Subject: Re: [junit] assertEquals(Object,
messageBody:
No.
----- Original Message -----
From: "Mike Clark" <mike@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, May 10, 2002 10:49 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] assertEquals(Object, Object)


> Alexander Zynevich wrote:
>
> >I feel signature and documentation are not exact, it states and looks as
if
> >assertEquals should work as assertEquals for primitive types but it is
not
> >so. Looking at source code I understand meaning of this method (and
> >limitations of course). Thanks :) But I expect this meaning in Javadoc :)
> >public static void assertEquals(java.lang.String message,
> > java.lang.Object expected,
> > java.lang.Object actual)
> > Asserts that two objects are equal. If they are not an
> >AssertionFailedError is thrown.
> >
>
> Is it possible you're confusing object equality with object identity?
>
> assertEquals(Object o1, Object o2)
> yields o1.equals(o2)
>
> assertSame(Object o1, Object o2)
> yeilds o1 == o2
>
>
